results.title: Kurt Russell and Goldie Hawn, a.k.a. Mr. and Mrs. Claus
results.abstract: Together 37 years but rarely paired onscreen, the real-life couple’s new Netflix holiday movie is an indication of how they — and Hollywood — have changed.

results.title: Scary Is How You Act, Not Look, Disability Advocates Tell Filmmakers
results.abstract: “The Witches,” a film in which Anne Hathaway’s character has disfigured hands, has resurfaced the debate over depicting evil as disabled.

results.abstract: On TikTok, Gen Z “Harry Potter” fans edit themselves into the movies in a quest for escapism, representation and community.

results.title: Academy Museum Gives Debbie Reynolds Her Due as a Costume Conservator
results.abstract: When the “Singin’ in the Rain” actress was alive, the film academy turned up its nose at her fabled costume collection. Now it has gone to her son with hat in hand.

multimedia.caption: “My mother was one of the most forgiving people ever,” said Todd Fisher, Debbie Reynolds’s son, who inherited the remaining part of her collection. “She would never want me to hold a grudge.”
